summary:
After triggering the "dark cinematic fantasy" enb flood, this enb goes in a way different direction.
Kiren enb offers bright days with mellow colors, a unique letterbox effect, a fully configured weatherlist and it utilises carefully crafted state of the art effects.
descriptionHtml:
[center]






LaBeatBeatbox





presents





a "mellow realism" enb preset

designed for NLA





K  I  R  E  N     E  N  B


____________________________________________________________________


[img]http://static-1.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/69529-1-1441810134.jpg[/img]

____________________________________________________________________





After triggering the "dark cinematic fantasy" enb flood and finishing Zaak Liir enb I wanted to try something new.

I wanted a realistic enb, but after a short time, I knew I wasnt comfortable with it. So I sat down,

and started reimagining the "realism", and I think I just hit the spot of that mellow, semi-realistic look

I originally was looking for.

The letterbox effect is of course optional.





____________________________________________________________________


[img]http://static-1.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/69529-0-1441810134.jpg[/img]

____________________________________________________________________


T H I S   E N B   F E A T U R E S





soft bloom shader

lens flare shading

high quality SSAO

dynamic depth of field effect with soft bokeh

High Dynamic Range lighting

OPTIONAL widescreen cinematic LETTERBOX

color dispersion

sharpen

sub-pixel-blurring


____________________________________________________________________


[img]http://static-6.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/69529-0-1441810215.jpg[/img]

____________________________________________________________________




R  E  Q  U  I  R  E  M  E  N  T  S


use d3d9.dll and enbhost files from 0.279 wrapper folder

available [url=http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0279.htm]HERE[/url]






"bfloatpointrendertarget" must be set to 1 in the skyrimprefs ini file 




and while you´re at it:


bTreesreceiveshadows=1

bDrawLandShadows=1

bShadowsOnGrass=1




If these are not featured within your skyrimprefs.ini, just add them.[/center]
author: LaBeatBeatbox
